issues.description: The problem statement uses a snake_case method name `get_total_number_of_students()` (line 41) which conflicts with the camelCase method name shown elsewhere in the problem UML (`getTotalNumberOfStudents()` at UML) and the implementation in the solution (`getTotalNumberOfStudents()` in Lecture.java). This inconsistent naming could confuse students about the exact method name/signature they must implement in Java (which conventionally uses camelCase).
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement to use the camelCase method name `getTotalNumberOfStudents()` consistently (matching the UML and the expected Java implementation). This removes ambiguity about the method signature students should implement.

issues.description: The example custom toString() in the problem statement shows numeric attributes quoted (e.g. numberOfInscribedStudents='600'), which visually suggests those numeric fields might be Strings. The UML and attribute descriptions declare those fields as ints. Quoting numeric values in the example may cause minor confusion about attribute types.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the example to avoid quoting integer values (e.g. numberOfInscribedStudents=600) or add a short note that the quotes are only present for string formatting in the example. This will make it clear that the attributes are ints as specified in the UML.
